title: Mud Cows & Corn : This Farm Wife Farm Life

tasks.task: Morning routine before feeding calves and managing farm operations
subtasks: Prepare children for school (driving them to/coaching them through getting ready)
Handle redirection or unexpected errands (e.g., stopping at a store)
Plan to address feeding in muddy conditions when husband returns
Evaluate the weather impact on farming operations
Feed adult animals (cows) through smaller lots due to ongoing calving

tasks.task: Managing feed and supplements for farm animals
subtasks: Confirm the destination and necessity of taking dairy steers to market
Assist with loading or transporting animals to market (e.g., helping with an extra trailer)
Monitor and manage animal needs (e.g., calves' milk consumption)

tasks.task: Securing farm income through deer corn sales
subtasks: Prepare corn for sale to deer hunters (identifying remaining corn to be bagged)
Learn and attempt to use a specialized knot for bagging corn ( husband's technique)
Face logistical challenges in farm operations (e.g., limited phone service, rural internet)
Plan feeding schedule adjustments based on weather and husband's responsibilities
Communicate with neighbors or customers (e.g., arranging calf market transportation)
Address multi-faceted responsibilities (e.g., writing freelance articles for agricultural magazines)
Acknowledge and embrace unexpected roles (e.g., gate holding)
